data.title: John Cleese
data.meta_description: John Cleese, born October 27, 1939 in Somerset, England, is one of the members of the legendary comedy group Monty Python.
data.text:
John Cleese, born October 27, 1939 in Somerset, England, is one of the original actors in the British comedy Monty Python’s Flying Circus. Cleese got his start in comedy while studying law in 1963 at Cambridge University where he joined the university’s esteemed comedy club the “Footlights.” Since then he has performed in numerous British comedy shows and has expanded his career into American films such as A Fish Called Wanda which he wrote and starred in, Die another Day and the second and third installments of the Shrek films.

Cleese’s voice is well known as he has narrated several films and TV programs varying from Disney’s House of Mouse to the 2000 video game 007 Racing. His future projects include Pink Panther 2, The Day the Earth Stood Still and the animated film Planet 51 with Gary Oldman and Jessica Biel.

While working in off-Broadway theaters as part of the 1963 Cambridge Footlights revue cast, Cleese met and married American actress Connie Booth. The couple has one daughter together. Booth and Cleese divorced but remain close friends and Cleese remarried in 1981 to American actress Barbara Trentham. He and Trentham divorced in 1990 and in 1992 he married for a third time and is currently with wife Alyce Faye Eichelberger.
